db:abstract.db:para: The QNearFieldTarget class provides an interface for communicating with a target device.
This class was introduced in Qt 5.2.

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: QNearFieldTarget provides a generic interface for communicating with an NFC target device. Both NFC Forum devices and NFC Forum Tag targets are supported by this class. All target specific classes subclass this class.

The type() function can be used to get the type of the target device. The uid() function returns the unique identifier of the target. The AccessMethods flags returns from the accessMethods() function can be tested to determine which access methods are supported by the target.

If the target supports NdefAccess, hasNdefMessage() can be called to test if the target has a stored NDEF message, readNdefMessages() and writeNdefMessages() functions can be used to get and set the NDEF message.

If the target supports TagTypeSpecificAccess, sendCommand() can be used to send a single proprietary command to the target and retrieve the response. sendCommands() can be used to send multiple proprietary commands to the target and retrieve all of the responses.
If the target supports LlcpAccess, the QLlcpSocket class can be used to connected to a service provided by the target.

db:section.db:title: enum QNearFieldTarget::AccessMethod
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the access methods a near field target supports.

db:td.db:para: The target supports an unknown access type.
The target supports reading and writing NDEF messages using readNdefMessages() and writeNdefMessages().
The target supports sending tag type specific commands using sendCommand() and sendCommands().
The target supports peer-to-peer LLCP communication.

db:section.db:para: The AccessMethods type is a typedef for QFlags<AccessMethod>. It stores an OR combination of AccessMethod values.

db:section.db:title: enum QNearFieldTarget::Error
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the error codes that that a near field target reports.

db:td.db:para: The requested operation is unsupported by this near field target.
The target is no longer within range.
The checksum has detected a corrupted response.
Invalid parameters were passed to a tag type specific function.
Failed to read NDEF messages from the target.
Failed to write NDEF messages to the target.

db:section.db:title: enum QNearFieldTarget::Type
db:section.db:para: This enum describes the type of tag the target is detected as.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QNearFieldTarget::QNearFieldTarget(QObject *parent = Q_NULLPTR)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a new near field target with parent.

db:section.db:title: [virtual noexcept] QNearFieldTarget::~QNearFieldTarget()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the near field target.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] QNearFieldTarget::AccessMethods QNearFieldTarget::accessMethods() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the access methods support by this near field target.

db:section.db:title: void QNearFieldTarget::disconnected()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when the near field target moves out of proximity.

db:section.db:title: void QNearFieldTarget::error(QNearFieldTarget::Error error, const QNearFieldTarget::RequestId &id)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when an error occurs while processing request id. The error parameter describes the error.

db:section.db:title: [virtual protected] bool QNearFieldTarget::handleResponse(const QNearFieldTarget::RequestId &id, const QByteArray &response)
db:section.db:para: Handles the response received for the request id. Returns true if the response is handled; otherwise returns false.
Classes reimplementing this virtual function should call the base class implementation to ensure that requests initiated by those classes are handled correctly.
The default implementation stores the response such that it can be retrieved by requestResponse().

db:section.db:title: [virtual] bool QNearFieldTarget::hasNdefMessage()
db:section.db:para: Returns true if at least one NDEF message is stored on the near field target; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: bool QNearFieldTarget::isProcessingCommand() const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if the target is processing commands; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: void QNearFieldTarget::ndefMessageRead(const QNdefMessage &message)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when a complete NDEF message has been read from the target.

db:section.db:title: void QNearFieldTarget::ndefMessagesWritten()
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when NDEF messages have been successfully written to the target.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QNearFieldTarget::RequestId QNearFieldTarget::readNdefMessages()
db:section.db:para: Starts reading NDEF messages stored on the near field target. Returns a request id which can be used to track the completion status of the request. An invalid request id will be returned if the target does not support reading NDEF messages.

An ndefMessageRead() signal will be emitted for each NDEF message. The requestCompleted() signal will be emitted was all NDEF messages have been read. The error() signal is emitted if an error occurs.

db:section.db:title: void QNearFieldTarget::requestCompleted(const QNearFieldTarget::RequestId &id)
db:section.db:para: This signal is emitted when a request id completes.

db:section.db:title: QVariant QNearFieldTarget::requestResponse(const QNearFieldTarget::RequestId &id)
db:section.db:para: Returns the decoded response for request id. If the request is unknown or has not yet been completed an invalid QVariant is returned.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QNearFieldTarget::RequestId QNearFieldTarget::sendCommand(const QByteArray &command)
db:section.db:para: Sends command to the near field target. Returns a request id which can be used to track the completion status of the request. An invalid request id will be returned if the target does not support sending tag type specific commands.
The requestCompleted() signal will be emitted on successful completion of the request; otherwise the error() signal will be emitted.
Once the request completes successfully the response can be retrieved from the requestResponse() function. The response of this request will be a QByteArray.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QNearFieldTarget::RequestId QNearFieldTarget::sendCommands(const QList<QByteArray> &commands)
db:section.db:para: Sends multiple commands to the near field target. Returns a request id which can be used to track the completion status of the request. An invalid request id will be returned if the target does not support sending tag type specific commands.

If all commands complete successfully the requestCompleted() signal will be emitted; otherwise the error() signal will be emitted. If a command fails succeeding commands from this call will not be processed.
Once the request completes the response for successfully completed requests can be retrieved from the requestResponse() function. The response of this request will be a QList<QByteArray>.

db:section.db:title: void QNearFieldTarget::setResponseForRequest(const QNearFieldTarget::RequestId &id, const QVariant &response, bool emitRequestCompleted = true)
db:section.db:para: Sets the decoded response for request id to response. If emitRequestCompleted is true the requestCompleted() signal will be emitted for id; otherwise no signal will be emitted.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] QNearFieldTarget::Type QNearFieldTarget::type() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the type of tag type of this near field target.

db:section.db:title: [pure virtual] QByteArray QNearFieldTarget::uid() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the UID of the near field target.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QUrl QNearFieldTarget::url() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the URL of the near field target.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] bool QNearFieldTarget::waitForRequestCompleted(const QNearFieldTarget::RequestId &id, int msecs = 5000)
db:section.db:para: Waits up to msecs milliseconds for the request id to complete. Returns true if the request completes successfully and the requestCompeted() signal is emitted; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: [virtual] QNearFieldTarget::RequestId QNearFieldTarget::writeNdefMessages(const QList<QNdefMessage> &messages)
db:section.db:para: Writes the NDEF messages in messages to the target. Returns a request id which can be used to track the completion status of the request. An invalid request id will be returned if the target does not support reading NDEF messages.
The ndefMessagesWritten() signal will be emitted when the write operation completes successfully; otherwise the error() signal is emitted.

db:section.db:title: quint16 qNfcChecksum(const char *data, uint len)
db:section.db:para: Returns the NFC checksum of the first len bytes of data.
